sn45.55:1.1: “Bhikkhus, the dawn is the forerunner and precursor of the sunrise.
sn45.55:1.2: In the same way, accomplishment in through-the-origin attention is the forerunner and precursor of the noble eightfold path for a bhikkhu.
sn45.55:1.3: It is expected that a bhikkhu accomplished in through-the-origin attention will develop and cultivate the noble eightfold path.
sn45.55:1.4: And how does a bhikkhu accomplished in through-the-origin attention develop and cultivate the noble eightfold path?
sn45.55:1.5: It’s when a bhikkhu develops right view, right intention, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right recollection, and right composure, relying on seclusion, fading away, and cessation, and ripening in relinquishment.
sn45.55:1.6: That’s how a bhikkhu accomplished in through-the-origin attention develops and cultivates the noble eightfold path.”
